intro: Huttonaea fimbriata, commonly known as the fimbriated huttonaea, is a rare and specialized plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant is distinguished by its finely fringed leaves, which give it its scientific name. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
